meanings.definition: A quantity of bread that is shaped and baked in one piece
meanings.sent1: Mom bought a fresh loaf of bread from the bakery.
meanings.sent2: I made sandwiches using the whole loaf of bread.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a loaf of bread from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as golden and soft as a freshly baked loaf of bread.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the warm loaf filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.sent1: Instead of studying, he decided to loaf around all day.
meanings.sent2: She likes to loaf on the couch and watch TV on lazy Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to loaf in the sun, soaking up the warmth.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to loaf by when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: Don't loaf away your opportunities; make the most of them!

meanings.sent1: They would loaf in the park, enjoying the breeze and sunshine.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his chores, he would loaf around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to loaf through the forest, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a leaf in the wind, loafing from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The clouds seemed to loaf across the sky, moving lazily with no rush.
